alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:44PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Rock, northern Brown and Keya Paha Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Littleburg to near Norden to 6 miles southwest of Johnstown. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Springview, Johnstown, Norden, Burton, Nets Peak, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak and Mills. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 197 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 224 and 243. Highway 12 between mile markers 15 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Nebraska.
